attack(army, strategy_)[source]¶

The attack of the army.

The attack success probability of the sum attack of each squad.

Args:
army: the army which we attack. strategy: the strategy with which we attack.
Returns:
The value of the attack.

Returns:

A list of the squads of this army. For example:

[<Battle.Squad.Squad object at 0x7f51b8bacba8>, <Battle.Squad.Squad object at 0x7f51b8bacf28>]

static take_damage(damage, strategy_name, army)[source]¶

The damage of the army.

Once the target is determined both the attacking and defending squads calculate their attack probability success and the squad with the highest probability wins. If the attacking squad wins, damage is dealt to the defending side, otherwise no damage is inflicted to the attacking side.

Args:
damage: the damage that we have caused. strategy_name: the strategy with which are attacking us. army: the army with which are attacking us.

Battle.BattleField module¶

class Battle.BattleField.BattleField(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

This simulator is determine a battle outcome based on probability calculations.

start()[source]¶

Once the simulator is started all the army squads will start attacking each other until there is only one army left.

Returns:
Number army, that won the battle.

Battle.Squad module¶

class Battle.Squad.Squad(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Squads are consisted out of a number of units (soldiers or vehicles), that behave as a coherent group. A squad is active as long as is contains an active unit.

do_attack¶

The attack of the squad.

The attack success probability of a squad is determined as the arithmetic average o the attack success probability of each member.

Returns:
The value of the attack.
get_experience¶

The experience of the squad.

Returns:
The sum of all experiences of units.
get_health¶

The health of the squad.

Returns:
The sum of all health of units.
take_damage(damage)[source]¶

The damage of the squad.

The damage received on a successful attack is distributed evenly to all squad members. The damage inflicted on a successful attack is the accumulation of the damage inflicted by each squad member.

Args:
damage: the value of damage, that caused this squad.

Battle.Units module¶

class Battle.Units.Solder[source]¶

Bases: Battle.Units.Unit

do_attack¶

Soldier attack

Soldiers attack success probability is calculated:

0.5 * (1 + health/100) * random(50 + experience, 100) / 100

where random(min, max) returns a random number between min and max (inclusive).

Returns:
The value of soldier attack.
get_experience¶

Represents the experience of the solder.

set_experience()[source]¶

We set the experience of the solder.

The experience property is incremented after each successful attack, and is sed to calculate the attack success probability and the amount of damage inflicted.

take_damage(damage)[source]¶

The amount of damage.

The amount of damage a soldier can afflict is calculated as follows:

0.05 + experience / 100

Args:
damage:
class Battle.Units.Unit[source]¶

Bases: object

Class-parent.

It contains the methods of attack, take damage. It allow you to set for unit a health, a recharge and next attack time. It allow you to get these options, and an experience and checking attack. Each unit represents either a soldier or a vehicle maned by a predetermined number of soldiers.

Attributes:
prev_time: the previous attack.
check_attack()[source]¶

We check, can a unit to attack.

Returns:

True: if now time exceed next attack time or if the unit do not attacked.

False: if now time do not exceed next attack time.

class Battle.Units.Vehicles[source]¶

Bases: Battle.Units.Unit

static alive(units)[source]¶

Survivors in the vehicle.

Args:
units: operators in the vehicle.
Returns:
If there are survivors, return True, else - return False.
do_attack¶

The Vehicle attack.

The Vehicle attack success probability is determined as follows:

0.5 * (1 + vehicle.health / 100) * gavg(operators.attack_success)

where gavg is the geometric average of the attack success of all the vehicle operators.

Returns:
Total value of the vehicle attack.
get_experience¶

The experience of the vehicle.

Returns:
The sum of all experiences of soldiers.
get_operators()[source]¶

The operators of the vehicle.

Returns:

A list of operators. For example:

[<Battle.Units.Solder object at 0x7fa64372b588>, <Battle.Units.Solder object at 0x7fa64372b5f8>]

operators = []¶
take_damage(damage)[source]¶

The damage of the vehicle.

The damage afflicted by a vehicle is calculated:

0.1 + sum(operators.experience / 100)

The total damage inflicted on the vehicle is distributed to the operators as follows: 60% of the total damage is inflicted on the vehicle 20% of the total damage is inflicted on a random vehicle operator. The rest of the damage is inflicted evenly to the other operators (10% each).

Args:
damage: the value of damage, that caused this vehicle.
